column1: Relapsing fever is an infection transmitted by a louse or tick.
Relapsing fever is an infection caused by several species of bacteria in the Borrelia family.
People may not have a fever for up to 2 weeks, and then it returns.
In the mountains of California, Utah, Arizona, New Mexico, Colorado, Oregon, and Washington, infections are usually caused by Borrelia hermsii and are often picked up in cabins in forests.
LBRF is mainly a disease of the developing world.
